wikipedia_page.main: Sholto Douglas (8 September 1873 – 28 January 1916) was an English first-class cricketer active 1906 who played for Middlesex. He was born in Norwood Green, Middlesex; died in Cambrin, Arras, France, on active service during World War I.

link_mentions.page: List of cricketers who were killed during military service

response: Sholto Douglas was the mythical progenitor of the Scottish Clan Douglas.
Sholto Douglas may also refer to:
* Sholto Douglas, 15th Earl of Morton (1732–1774), Scottish nobleman and peer
* Sholto Douglas (naval officer), (1833–1913) Admiral in the Royal Navy
* Sholto Douglas, 19th Earl of Morton (1844–1935), Scottish landowner, businessman and representative peer
* Sholto Douglas, 1st Baron Douglas of Kirtleside (1893–1969), Marshal of the Royal Air Force
